creator: replayit@post.cz
text:
Hello Apache developers,
I try to use mod_proxy (mod_proxy_http) on APACHE 2.0.52 to proxy a Windows 
Media streaming services 9 on HTTP protocol. It works OK, but when stream 
duration is long (minutes) APACHE2 start to eat server memory slowly and its 
unlimited process. 
Memory is cleaned if I restart APACHE2.

I try to emulate more users with MS media load test software and for 100 users 
its eat 100KB each 10 seconds.

I tried both patch from BUG 31952 and Chunked content encoding patch from 
http://www.apache.org/~trawick page. No success.

This is the header from stream with data:
-----------------------------------------

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/x-mms-framed
Server: Cougar/9.00.00.3380
Date: Tue, 01 Feb 2005 13:32:19 GMT
Pragma: no-cache, client-id=841485782, features="broadcast", timeout=60000, 
AccelBW=0, AccelDuration=0, Speed=1.000
Cache-Control: no-cache, x-wms-event-subscription="remote-log", x-wms-stream-
type="broadcast"
Last-Modified: Sat, 30 Dec 1899 00:00:00 GMT
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Supported: com.microsoft.wm.srvppair, com.microsoft.wm.sswitch, 
com.microsoft.wm.predstrm, com.microsoft.wm.fastcache

-----------------------------------------------------

If you need more info or test I can help.

Thanks for help 
Rudolf

creator: terry@kryogenic.co.uk
text: I have the same problem with trying to proxy 2 Axis webcams

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
Are you in a position to try mod_proxy from httpd-2.1 or current CVS? 
It would be useful to know whether they have a similar problem.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Are you in a position to try mod_proxy from httpd-2.1 or current CVS? 
> It would be useful to know whether they have a similar problem. 

Current http (2005-02-16) from 2.0 branch have the same problem.
creator: replayit@post.cz

text:
Current httpd (2005-02-16) from CVS 2.1 branch tree with last APR have the same 
problem. System is Gentoo with kernel 2.6.10
creator: replayit@post.cz

text:
The same problem is on actual httpd for win32. Tested on precompiled version 
2.0.53 on Widnows 2003 server.
creator: replayit@post.cz

text:
I am using Reverse Proxy configurations like:

ProxyRequests Off

<Proxy *>

Order deny,allow
Allow from all

</Proxy>

ProxyPass /foo http://foo.example.com/bar
ProxyPassReverse /foo http://foo.example.com/bar
creator: replayit@post.cz
replayit@post.cz
text:
Hello,

I am the director of the company trying to solve this problem.  Our client has 
approved us to pay $500 to someone that can fix this memoryleak. This problem 
is becoming critical and we really need to solve it.

If you would like to talk to us directly to expedite a resolution, you can call 
USA 800-341-0860

Thanks

A fix for this has been commited to subversion in r154200:
http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=154200&view=rev

I am going to propose a backport to the 2.0.x branch.
creator: chip@force-elite.com

text:
Created attachment 14308
Backport of r154200 to 2.0.x branch

Proposed backport with this patch to the 2.0.x branch.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
chip@force-elite.com
text:
Backported to 2.0.x in r r155391.  The fix will part of 2.0.54.

Thanks for using Apache.
